content.prompt: The velocity of a particle at time tâ‰¥0 seconds can be represented by the vector-valued function vt=3-t,-2t+5. Which of the following describes the motion of the particle near time t=2 seconds?

choices.label: The particle is moving up and to the right.
The particle is moving down and to the right.
The particle is moving up and to the left.
The particle is moving down and to the left.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
